result.execSummary:
The defendant Dravin P Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Successfully complete domestic abuse counseling. Submit DNA sample. Same conditions for both counts.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

filed by Attorney Caudill

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Dravin P Woods in court.  Attorney Eric James Caudill in court for Dravin P Woods. Defendant would like to accept the offer today. Court in recess. 9:06/10:01 Court resumed appearances the same. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 3 & 4. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 1 & 2 dismissed and read in. Victim made a statement. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 2 years each count. Conditions of probation include: Successfully complete domestic abuse counseling. Submit DNA sample. Count 3 costs of $543.00 and count 4 costs of $343.00. 2 days credit. 10:20 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:10 pm. Return date scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
allowing the victim/defendant to have contact by phone, zoom, text, computer, no face to face contact unless during counseling sessions with guardian. All other conditions remain. Faxed to dispatch

9:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dravin P Woods in court.  Attorney Eric Caudill in court for Dravin P Woods. Victim's guardian appeared by phone. Hearing is in re: defense request to amend bond allowing victim to have contact with defendant. State objects with argument. Statement by guardian. Statement by victim. Court modified bond allowing contact by phone, zoom, text, computer, no face to face contact unless during counseling sessions with guardian. Per defense, case not resolved, request a reset. Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:10 pm. Return date scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:00 am. 9:07 AM
